intro: Mimusops somalensis, commonly known as the Somali satinwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its dense, glossy green foliage and showy yellow flowers. The tree produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed surrounded by a fleshy, sticky pulp. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas and dry forests. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
